result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah N. Solis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaiah N. Solis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Isaiah N. Solis was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: APPLY $150 BOND & PAYMENT PLAN OF $50 PER MONTH ON BALANCE. $15 PAYMENT PLAN FEE WILL BE ADDED

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah N. Solis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah N. Solis in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that there is an agreement to Ct. 1.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed.  Atty Bonnett agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed.

Atty Bonnett makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 10 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 9 days
Time Served
Pay fine and costs = $442.00
Bond to be applied
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing in June
Defendant agrees to payment plan fee of $15.00.
Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed.

Court advises defendant of DNA Sample requirement per statute.
Defendant's copy of Notice of Hearing (Return Date) returned by USPS as undeliverable and unable to forward.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he believes that the defendant is in custody and did not get him here today.  There has been some discussion with Atty Gumz on possible resolution.  
Atty Hendee states that the parties are requesting a reset.  Atty Gumz states that his client is in Portage County jail and will be there until April 13th.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.
**SEND NOTICE TO PORTAGE COUNTY JAIL  Return date scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
CASH WAS POSTED 2/2/15 IN PORTAGE COUNTY - WE RECEIVED 2/6/15

Stipulation and Order   Signed by BNB/1-30-15
- modified bond from $250 cash to $150 cash; no conditions requested.

Signed by BNB/1-30-15
- to modify cash bond from $250 cash to $150 cash
Return date on March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.

Defendant Isaiah N. Solis in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requesting a $250 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has had warrants for non-appearances in Lincoln County and Portage County.  Defendant asks for a signature bond.
Defendant's step-father makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 cash bond; no conditions.

  Return date scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
